AT length a letter-carrier from my son?1 And, by Hercules, a letter elegantly expressed, showing in itself some progress. Others also give me excellent reports of him. Leonides? however, still sticks to his favorite “ at present.'’ But Herodes² speaks in the highest terms of him. In short, I am glad even to be deceived in this matter, and am not sorry to be credu- lous. Pray let me know if Statius has written to you anything of importance to me.
